intro: Pisophaca famelica, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, surrounded by green bracts. It grows in a variety of habitats, including meadows and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
